description.zh-cn: 指西方基督教在16世纪至17世纪的神学改革运动，导致新教的产生和基督宗教的第二次大分裂。
description.en: A theological reform movement in Western Christianity during the 16th and 17th centuries, which led to the creation of Protestantism and the second major schism in Christianity.

description.zh-cn: 基督宗教的最大宗派，由教宗领导。在宗教改革前是西欧唯一的基督教派。
description.en: The largest Christian denomination, led by the Pope. It was the sole Christian church in Western Europe before the Reformation.

description.zh-cn: 德国神学家、神父和修士，宗教改革的主要发起人，信义宗（路德宗）的创始人。
description.en: A German theologian, priest, and monk who was a seminal figure in the Protestant Reformation and the founder of Lutheranism.

description.zh-cn: 法国神学家、律师，宗教改革的杰出领袖，创立了加尔文主义（归正宗）。
description.en: A French theologian, pastor and reformer in Geneva during the Protestant Reformation who founded Calvinism.

description.zh-cn: 瑞士宗教改革的领袖，在苏黎世推动改革运动。
description.en: A leader of the Reformation in Switzerland, who led the reform movement in Zürich.

description.zh-cn: 英格兰国王，因婚姻问题与罗马教廷决裂，发起了英格兰宗教改革，创立了英格兰教会。
description.en: King of England who, due to marital issues, broke with the Papacy, initiated the English Reformation, and founded the Church of England.

description.zh-cn: 基督宗教三大分支之一，由16世纪的宗教改革运动中脱离天主教会的教派组成。
description.en: One of the three major branches of Christianity, formed by denominations that separated from the Catholic Church during the 16th-century Reformation.

description.zh-cn: 由马丁·路德撰写，批判天主教会出售赎罪券的做法，其发表被视为宗教改革的开端。
description.en: Written by Martin Luther to criticize the practice of selling indulgences by the Catholic Church, its publication is considered the start of the Reformation.

description.zh-cn: 英国神学家，宗教改革的先驱，主张圣经是信仰的唯一根据，并将圣经翻译成英文。
description.en: An English scholastic philosopher, theologian, biblical translator, reformer, and a precursor to the Protestant Reformation. He advocated that the Bible is the sole standard of Christian faith and translated it into English.

description.zh-cn: 波希米亚神学家和宗教改革家，受威克里夫思想影响，因批判教会腐败和赎罪券而被康士坦斯大公会议处以火刑。
description.en: A Bohemian theologian and reformer, influenced by Wycliffe, who was burned at the stake by the Council of Constance for his criticism of church corruption and indulgences.

description.zh-cn: 结束三十年战争的一系列条约，通常被认为是宗教改革时期的结束标志。
description.en: A series of peace treaties that ended the Thirty Years' War, generally considered to mark the end of the Reformation era.

description.zh-cn: 一场主要在中欧进行的宗教战争，是新教与天主教势力之间最大规模的冲突。
description.en: A religious war fought primarily in Central Europe, it was the largest conflict between Protestant and Catholic forces.

description.zh-cn: 由马丁·路德发起的新教主要宗派之一。
description.en: A major branch of Protestantism founded by Martin Luther.

description.zh-cn: 由约翰·加尔文等神学家发展出来的新教主要宗派之一。
description.en: A major branch of Protestantism developed by theologians such as John Calvin.

description.zh-cn: 天主教会为回应新教的宗教改革而发起的内部革新运动。
description.en: The period of Catholic resurgence that was initiated in response to the Protestant Reformation.

description.zh-cn: 天主教会召开的大公会议，是反宗教改革运动的核心。
description.en: An ecumenical council of the Catholic Church, which was central to the Counter-Reformation.

description.zh-cn: 天主教的主要修会之一，在反宗教改革运动中扮演先锋角色。
description.en: A major religious order of the Catholic Church that played a pioneering role in the Counter-Reformation.

description.zh-cn: 15世纪出现的欧洲思想运动，重视教育、思考和研究，对宗教改革产生了重要影响。
description.en: A European intellectual movement of the 15th century that emphasized education, thought, and research, and had a significant impact on the Reformation.

description.zh-cn: 罗马教宗，因批准出售赎罪券以修缮圣伯多禄大殿而引发争议，并将马丁·路德逐出教会。
description.en: The Pope who authorized the sale of indulgences to finance the rebuilding of St. Peter's Basilica, which sparked controversy, and he excommunicated Martin Luther.

description.zh-cn: 天主教会颁发的一种文件，声称可以减少信徒在炼狱中受罚的时间。其售卖成为宗教改革的直接导火索。
description.en: A document issued by the Catholic Church that was claimed to reduce the time a believer spent in purgatory. Its sale became a direct trigger for the Reformation.

nodes.id: 查理五世 (神圣罗马帝国)

zh-cn: 查理五世 (神圣罗马帝国)

description.zh-cn: 神圣罗马皇帝，支持教宗，反对宗教改革，并下令通缉马丁·路德。
description.en: The Holy Roman Emperor who supported the Pope, opposed the Reformation, and issued an edict for the arrest of Martin Luther.

nodes.id: 弗里德里希三世 (萨克森)

zh-cn: 弗里德里希三世 (萨克森)

description.zh-cn: 萨克森选帝侯，马丁·路德的坚定支持者和保护者。
description.en: The Elector of Saxony, who was a staunch supporter and protector of Martin Luther.

description.zh-cn: 罗马教宗，因拒绝批准英王亨利八世的婚姻无效请求，而导致英格兰教会脱离罗马教廷。
description.en: The Pope whose refusal to grant an annulment to King Henry VIII of England led to the separation of the Church of England from the Papacy.

description.zh-cn: 由英王亨利八世创立的英国国教。
description.en: The established state church in England, founded by King Henry VIII.

description.zh-cn: 英国国会通过的法案，宣布英国国王为英格兰教会的最高领袖。
description.en: Acts of the Parliament of England that established the English monarch as the head of the Church of England.

description.zh-cn: 加尔文主义的核心神学理论，主张人得救与否完全由上帝预定。
description.en: A central theological doctrine in Calvinism, which holds that salvation is entirely predestined by God.

description.zh-cn: 天主教会召开的大公会议，为解决天主教会大分裂而召开，会议期间将扬·胡斯处以火刑。
description.en: An ecumenical council of the Catholic Church convened to end the Western Schism, during which Jan Hus was executed.

description.zh-cn: 因扬·胡斯被处死而在波希米亚爆发的反对教廷的战争。
description.en: Wars fought in Bohemia against the Papacy, triggered by the execution of Jan Hus.

description.zh-cn: 英格兰国王，因试图恢复旧教并迫害清教徒，引发英国内战并最终被处决。
description.en: King of England whose attempts to restore Catholicism and persecute Puritans led to the English Civil War and his own execution.

description.zh-cn: 英国新教徒中的一个团体，受加尔文主义影响，主张清除英格兰教会中的天主教残余。
description.en: A group of English Protestants influenced by Calvinism who sought to purify the Church of England of its Catholic practices.

description.zh-cn: 英国议会派（主要是清教徒）与保皇派之间的一系列武装冲突。
description.en: A series of armed conflicts between Parliamentarians (largely Puritans) and Royalists in England.

description.zh-cn: 英格兰国王，因试图恢复天主教和专制政治而被光荣革命推翻。
description.en: King of England who was overthrown in the Glorious Revolution for attempting to restore Catholicism and absolutist rule.

description.zh-cn: 一场没有流血的政变，推翻了詹姆士二世，确立了英国君主立宪制和宗教宽容政策。
description.en: A bloodless coup that overthrew James II, establishing a constitutional monarchy and religious toleration in England.

nodes.id: 德西德里乌斯·伊拉斯谟

zh-cn: 德西德里乌斯·伊拉斯谟

description.zh-cn: 荷兰人文主义思想家和神学家，校订出版了希腊文《新约圣经》，并与马丁·路德就自由意志问题进行辩论。
description.en: A Dutch humanist and theologian who edited and published a Greek edition of the New Testament and debated with Martin Luther on the issue of free will.

description.zh-cn: 宗教改革运动源于对天主教会及教宗在宗教和政治权力上的挑战。
description.en: The Reformation originated from a challenge to the religious and political authority of the Catholic Church and the Pope.

description.zh-cn: 宗教改革运动直接导致了新教的形成。
description.en: The Reformation directly led to the formation of Protestantism.

description.zh-cn: 马丁·路德是宗教改革的主要发起人之一。
description.en: Martin Luther was one of the main initiators of the Reformation.

description.zh-cn: 约翰·加尔文是宗教改革的主要发起人之一。
description.en: John Calvin was one of the main initiators of the Reformation.

description.zh-cn: 乌利希·慈运理是宗教改革的主要发起人之一。
description.en: Huldrych Zwingli was one of the main initiators of the Reformation.

description.zh-cn: 亨利八世发起了英格兰的宗教改革。
description.en: Henry VIII initiated the Reformation in England.

description.zh-cn: 《九十五条论纲》的发表被视为宗教改革的开端。
description.en: The publication of the Ninety-five Theses is considered the beginning of the Reformation.

description.zh-cn: 马丁·路德撰写并发表了《九十五条论纲》。
description.en: Martin Luther wrote and published the Ninety-five Theses.

description.zh-cn: 教宗良十世下令将马丁·路德处以破门律，驱逐出教。
description.en: Pope Leo X ordered Martin Luther to be excommunicated and expelled from the Church.

relationships.source: 查理五世 (神圣罗马帝国)

description.zh-cn: 神圣罗马皇帝查理五世发布诏书通缉马丁·路德。
description.en: Holy Roman Emperor Charles V issued an edict declaring Martin Luther an outlaw.

relationships.source: 弗里德里希三世 (萨克森)

description.zh-cn: 萨克森选帝侯腓特烈三世是马丁·路德最坚定的支持者，为他提供了保护，使其免于被捕。
description.en: Elector Frederick III of Saxony was Martin Luther's staunchest supporter, providing him with protection from arrest.

description.zh-cn: 马丁·路德创立了信义宗（路德会）。
description.en: Martin Luther founded Lutheranism (the Lutheran Church).

description.zh-cn: 约翰·威克里夫是宗教改革的先驱，早于马丁·路德便提出了改革思想。
description.en: John Wycliffe was a forerunner of the Reformation, proposing reformist ideas before Martin Luther.

description.zh-cn: 扬·胡斯因阅读约翰·威克里夫的著作后深受感动，并采纳其改革思想。
description.en: Jan Hus was deeply moved after reading the works of John Wycliffe and adopted his reformist ideas.

description.zh-cn: 康士坦斯大公会议将扬·胡斯拘留，并于1415年7月6日将其处以火刑。
description.en: The Council of Constance detained Jan Hus and sentenced him to be burned at the stake on July 6, 1415.

description.zh-cn: 将扬·胡斯处死引起了波希米亚反教廷的胡斯战争。
description.en: The execution of Jan Hus triggered the Hussite Wars in Bohemia against the Papacy.

description.zh-cn: 《西发里亚和约》的签订结束了三十年战争。
description.en: The signing of the Peace of Westphalia ended the Thirty Years' War.

description.zh-cn: 天主教会的“反宗教改革”运动是对新教宗教改革的回应。
description.en: The Catholic Church's 'Counter-Reformation' movement was a response to the Protestant Reformation.

description.zh-cn: 天主教会发起了反宗教改革运动以进行内部革新并对抗新教。
description.en: The Catholic Church initiated the Counter-Reformation for internal reform and to counter Protestantism.

description.zh-cn: 特伦托会议的召开是反宗教改革运动的核心。
description.en: The convening of the Council of Trent was central to the Counter-Reformation movement.

description.zh-cn: 耶稣会是反宗教改革革新运动的先锋。
description.en: The Society of Jesus (Jesuits) were pioneers of the Counter-Reformation movement.

description.zh-cn: 人文主义思想重视思考和研究，对宗教改革运动有很大的影响。
description.en: Humanist thought, which valued critical thinking and research, had a great influence on the Reformation.

relationships.source: 德西德里乌斯·伊拉斯谟

description.zh-cn: 伊拉斯谟就自由意志的议题与马丁·路德展开激烈的论战。
description.en: Erasmus engaged in a fierce debate with Martin Luther on the issue of free will.

description.zh-cn: 教宗克勉七世拒绝了亨利八世的婚姻无效请求。
description.en: Pope Clement VII refused Henry VIII's request for an annulment of his marriage.

description.zh-cn: 亨利八世宣布脱离罗马教廷，使英格兰教会独立于天主教会之外。
description.en: Henry VIII declared a break from the Roman Papacy, making the Church of England independent of the Catholic Church.

description.zh-cn: 亨利八世通过《至尊法案》创立了英格兰教会，并成为其最高领袖。
description.en: Henry VIII founded the Church of England through the Act of Supremacy, becoming its supreme head.

description.zh-cn: 《至尊法案》从法律上确立了英格兰教会的独立地位以及英国君主的领袖身份。
description.en: The Act of Supremacy legally established the independence of the Church of England and the monarch's role as its head.

description.zh-cn: 约翰·加尔文是归正宗（加尔文派）神学的主要奠基人。
description.en: John Calvin was the principal founder of the theology of Reformed Christianity (Calvinism).

description.zh-cn: 约翰·加尔文主张并系统阐述了预选说。
description.en: John Calvin advocated and systematically articulated the doctrine of predestination.

description.zh-cn: 在1529年的马尔堡会议中，慈运理因对圣餐的看法与路德不同而与信义宗分道扬镳。
description.en: At the Marburg Colloquy in 1529, Zwingli's different view on the Eucharist led to a split with Luther and the Lutherans.

description.zh-cn: 英王查理一世迫害清教徒，试图在英国恢复旧教仪式。
description.en: King Charles I of England persecuted the Puritans, attempting to restore Catholic rituals in England.

description.zh-cn: 查理一世与国会（主要由清教徒控制）的冲突最终引发了英国内战。
description.en: The conflict between Charles I and Parliament (largely controlled by Puritans) ultimately triggered the English Civil War.

description.zh-cn: 光荣革命推翻了国王詹姆士二世的统治。
description.en: The Glorious Revolution overthrew the rule of King James II.
